00020 /*
00021 Instance specific extensions, are extension that only a single instance of a module
00022 may access. They are invisible to all other modules; they are private to this
00023 instance so to speak.
00024 
00025 As they are only of value to a certain instance, this instance knows very well
00026 when it needs them and when it does not need them any longer (usually when
00027 a transaction passes through a module for the last time).
00028 It does not have to care if anyone else in the system may still have a
00029 reference to the transaction as this one is not able to access the extension
00030 anyway.
00031 Therefore the instance is obliged to call set_extension when it wants to add a
00032 private extension and clear_extension when it does not need it any more.
00033 
00034 To get access to an instance specifc extension the module must own a so called
00035 instance_specific_extension_accessor that provides the exclusive access rights.
00036 Assuming the instance_specific_extension_accessor of a given module is called m_accessor
00037 and the transaction of which the private extension is about to be accessed
00038 is called txn, then the calls have to be
00039 
00040 m_accessor(txn).set_extension(...);
00041 or
00042 m_accessor(txn).clear_extension(...);
00043 
00044 The owner of the private extension is responsible to allocate/deallocate
00045 the extension before/after setting/clearing the extension.
00046 */
00047

00055 //The templated private extension. Similar to normal extension
00056 template <typename T>
00057 class instance_specific_extension : public ispex_base {
00058 public:
00059     virtual ~instance_specific_extension() {}
00060     const static unsigned int priv_id;
00061 };
00062 
00063 template <typename T>
00064 const unsigned int instance_specific_extension<T>::priv_id
00065   = ispex_base::register_private_extension(typeid(T));

00069 // This is the class that actually sits in the extension array
00070 // - we keep this small since that one gets allocated and deallocated all the times
00071 // - we keep the implementation in the header to avoid registration
00072 //   of the extension itself unless used in the model
00073 class instance_specific_extension_carrier
00074   : public tlm::tlm_extension<instance_specific_extension_carrier>
00075 {
00076   friend class instance_specific_extension_accessor;
00077 public:
00078   instance_specific_extension_carrier()
00079     : m_container()
00080   {}
00081 
00082   virtual tlm::tlm_extension_base* clone() const {
00083     //we don't clone since private info is instance specific and associated to a given txn (the original)
00084     //so the deep copied txn will be virgin in terms of private info
00085     return NULL;
00086   }
00087 
00088   void copy_from(tlm::tlm_extension_base const &) { return; }
00089   void free() { return; }
00090 
00091 private:
00092   instance_specific_extension_container* m_container;
00093 };
00094 
00095 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00096 
00097 template<typename T>
00098 instance_specific_extensions_per_accessor&
00099 instance_specific_extension_accessor::operator()(T& txn)
00100 {
00101   instance_specific_extension_carrier* carrier = NULL;
00102   txn.get_extension(carrier);
00103   if (!carrier) {
00104     carrier = new instance_specific_extension_carrier();
00105     carrier->m_container = instance_specific_extension_container::create();
00106     carrier->m_container->attach_carrier(carrier, &txn, &release_carrier<T>);
00107     txn.set_extension(carrier);
00108   }
00109   return *carrier->m_container->get_accessor(m_index);
00110 }
00111 
00112 template<typename T>
00113 void
00114 instance_specific_extension_accessor::
00115   release_carrier(instance_specific_extension_carrier* carrier, void* txn)
00116 {
00117   T* typed_txn = static_cast<T*>(txn);
00118   typed_txn->clear_extension(carrier);
00119   delete carrier;
00120 }
